element.name: TSynXMLSyn.CommentAttri
element.short: Highlight info for comments in XML
element.descr:
Color and style to be used for comments.
This does not include the comment-marker <!-- and -->. Those are symbols, but can have their own attributes.

element.name: TSynXMLSyn.CommentSymbolAttri
element.short: Highlight info for comment markers (symbols) in XML
element.descr:
Color and style to be used for the symbols starting and ending a comment. <!-- and -->
Those markers are highlighted as normal symbols. But if any property in this CommentSymbolAttri is set, then the colors from this attribute will be used.

element.name: TSynXMLSyn.ProcessingInstructionSymbolAttri
element.short: Highlight info for processing instruction markers (symbols) <? and ?> in XML
element.descr:
Color and style to be used for the symbols starting and ending a processing instruction. <? and ?>
Those markers are highlighted as normal symbols. But if any property in this ProcessingInstructionSymbolAttri is set, then the colors from this attribute will be used.

element.name: TSynXMLSyn.ProcessingInstructionAttri
element.short: Overlay highlight info for entire processing instruction in XML
element.descr:
Additional Color and style to be used for entire processing instruction. Between and including <? and ?>
The settings from this Attribute can overlay other attributes that apply to different parts of such an instruction. They can replace them by priority, or merge using an Alpha channel.

element.name: TSynXMLSyn.SymbolAttri
element.short: Highlight info for symbols in XML
element.descr:
Color and style to be used for symbols. E.g. <>!?/=" and combinations of those.
Some symbols may have their own Attributes. They may use this setting as a fallback, if they have no setting at all. That is "fallback" is not per color/style, but for the entire TSynHighlighterAttribute (if the alternative has no single property set).
